template.name: PFSense by SNMP
template.description:
Template for monitoring pfSense by SNMP Setup: 1. Enable SNMP daemon at Services in pfSense web interface https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/services/snmp.html 2. Setup firewall rule to get access from Zabbix proxy or Zabbix server by SNMP https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/firewall/index.html#managing-firewall-rules 3. Link template to the host
MIBs used: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB HOST-RESOURCES-MIB
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: PFSense: DHCP server status
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The status of DHCP server process.

trigger.name: PFSense: DHCP server is not running

item.name: PFSense: DNS server status
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The status of DNS server process.

trigger.name: PFSense: DNS server is not running

item.name: PFSense: State of nginx process
item.description: MIB: HOST-RESOURCES-MIB The status of nginx process.

trigger.name: PFSense: Web server is not running

item.name: PFSense: Packets with bad offset
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Fragmented packets
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Packets matched a filter rule
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Packets dropped due to memory limitation
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Normalized packets
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Short packets
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if the packet was logged with the specified packet filter reason code. The known codes are: match, bad-offset, fragment, short, normalize, and memory.

item.name: PFSense: Packet filter running status
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB True if packet filter is currently enabled.

trigger.name: PFSense: Packet filter is not running

item.name: PFSense: Firewall rules count
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of labeled filter rules on this system.

item.name: PFSense: Source tracking table current
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Number of entries in the source tracking table.

item.name: PFSense: Source tracking table limit
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Maximum number of 'sticky-address' or 'source-track' rules in the ruleset.

item.name: PFSense: Source tracking table utilization in %
item.description: Utilization of source tracking table in %.

trigger.name: PFSense: Source tracking table usage is high
trigger.event_name: PFSense: Source tracking table usage more than {$SOURCE.TRACKING.TABLE.UTIL.MAX}.
trigger.description: Please check the number of sticky connections https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/monitoring/status/firewall-states-sources.html

item.name: PFSense: States table current
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Number of entries in the state table.

item.name: PFSense: States table limit
item.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB Maximum number of 'keep state' rules in the ruleset.

trigger.name: PFSense: State table usage is high
trigger.event_name: PFSense: State table usage more than {$STATE.TABLE.UTIL.MAX}.
trigger.description: Please check the number of connections https://docs.netgate.com/pfsense/en/latest/config/advanced-firewall-nat.html#config-advanced-firewall-maxstates

item.name: PFSense: SNMP agent availability
item.description: Availability of SNMP checks on the host. The value of this item corresponds to availability icons in the host list. Possible value: 0 - not available 1 - available 2 - unknown

trigger.name: PFSense: No SNMP data collection
trigger.description: SNMP is not available for polling. Please check device connectivity and SNMP settings.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets blocked coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate
trigger_prototype.event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High input error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv4 packets passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound IPv6 packets passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets passed coming in on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 traffic blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 packets blocked
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets blocked going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate
trigger_prototype.event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High output error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv4 bits per second passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv4 packets passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv4 packets passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 traffic passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB IPv6 bits per second passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound IPv6 packets passed
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of IPv6 packets passed going out on this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Rules references count
item_prototype.description: MIB: BEGEMOT-PF-MIB The number of rules referencing this interface.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Link down
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down.

item_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Interface type
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The type of interface. Additional values for ifType are assigned by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), through updating the syntax of the IANAifType textual convention.

trigger_prototype.expression: change(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])<0 and last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and ( last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=6 or last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=7 or last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=11 or last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=62 or last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=69 or last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.type[{#SNMPINDEX}])=117 ) and (last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])<>2)
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: (change(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0 and last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}],#2)>0) or (last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.status[{#SNMPINDEX}])=2)
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
trigger_prototype.description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.in[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High inbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

trigger_prototype.expression: (avg(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.out[{#SNMPINDEX}],15m)>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])) and last(/PFSense by SNMP/net.if.speed[{#SNMPINDEX}])>0
trigger_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High outbound bandwidth usage
trigger_prototype.event_name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: High outbound bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

graph_prototype.name: PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Inbound packet filter traffic
PFSense: Interface [{#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS})]: Outbound packet filter traffic

macro.description: Threshold of error packets rate for warning trigger. Can be used with interface name as context.
Threshold of interface bandwidth utilization for warning trigger in %. Can be used with interface name as context.
Macro for operational state of the interface for link down trigger. Can be used with interface name as context.
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro is used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
This macro used in filters of network interfaces discovery rule.
The time interval for SNMP availability trigger.
Threshold of source tracking table utilization trigger in %.
Threshold of state table utilization trigger in %.
